Error/NotEnoughFury=Not enough Fury
Error/NotEnsnared=Can't use while ensnared
Error/NotIncapacitated=Can't target dead Heroes
Error/NotOgrenaut=Can't target the Ogrenaut
Error/NotOneFifth=Target unit needs to be lower than <d ref="Validator,SalvageTargetLifeCheck,Value * 100"/>% Health.
Error/NotOneTenth=Target unit needs to be lower than 10% Health.
Error/NotRooted=Can't do that while Rooted
Error/NotVehicle=Must target Hero
Error/OgreCampNearby=Must use near an Knight Camp
Error/OgreCampsNearby=Must use near an Knight Camp
Error/PassiveItem=That item is passive
Error/PortalArtifact=Must Target Unit or Structure
Error/SindragosaStructureDebuff=Structure is currently frozen
Error/TakingDamage=Can't use while taking damage
Error/TargetNotBazooka=Target is poisoned
Error\HasGhouls=Must have at least 1 Ghoul
Error\MustTargetDeadTower=Must target a destroyed Tower
Error\MustTargetUnoccupiedSite=Must target unoccupied Build Site
Error\NoLightningShield=Target already has Lightning Shield
Error\NoWrathOfTheLichKingPull=Target is already being pulled
Error\NotHooked=Target is already being pulled

Hero/Info/Sylvanas=Sylvanas Windrunner was not always the Dark Lady of the Forsaken. In another life, she was the Ranger-General of Silvermoon. But that was before the Death Knight Arthas slew her and her people and raised her as the first Banshee.
Hero/Info/Tassadar=An Executor without equal, Tassadar has fought tirelessly to purify the Koprulu sector of zerg infestation. Only now, after learning to wield the power of the void, is Tassadar finally ready to face the Overmind and its all-consuming Swarm.
Hero/Info/Thrall=As a child, Thrall served the cruel Aedelas Blackmoore as a slave. After gaining his freedom, he guided the liberated orcs to a land of their own and worked to recover their ancient traditions. Now and forever he is the Warchief of the Horde.
Hero/Info/Tinker=Few would consider Gazlowe a fighter, but what he lacks in height, he makes up in mechanical know-how. Besides, you don't get to be boss of a "boom"-town like Ratchet with just a charming personality, if you know what I mean.
Hero/Info/Tychus=Tychus Findlay is a big man with a big ego and a bigger gun. Fortunately, his loyalty is easily won. Buy him a drink or three and promise him enough credits, and there's no job in the whole universe too dangerous for this outlaw.
Hero/Info/Tyrael=Among the angels it is the Archangel of Justice Tyrael who is humanity's greatest defender. Wielding his sword El'druin against the Burning Hells, the Prime Evils would have enslaved humanity long ago if Tyrael had not intervened.
Hero/Info/Tyrande=Tyrande Whisperwind strikes fear into all who wish ill of the Kaldorei. As the highest ranking Sentinel and High Priestess of Elune, she is not only the night elves' most deadly warrior, but also their most cunning leader.
Hero/Info/Uther=The first paladin and founder of the Order of the Silver Hand, Uther the Lightbringer is a faithful servant of the Light. Dispensing justice with the swing of his hammer, Uther is a bastion of truth and an unflinching symbol of the Alliance.
Hero/Info/WitchDoctor=With cabalistic incantations and vestments of feather and bone, the witch doctor Nazeebo calls upon spirits from the Unformed Land to aid him. Few outlanders encounter a witch doctor in the flesh, without losing their own.
Hero/Info/Wizard=The derogatory moniker "wizard" is often given to mages with rebellious attitudes or an obsession with power. Li-Ming displays a little of both and she's hardly ashamed of it. After all, who are they to judge a wielder of limitless arcane magic?
Hero/Info/Zagara=If Kerrigan is the Queen of the Zerg, then Zagara is the mother of the brood. Cunning and tenacious, she commands her minions on the field of battle. Encounter her brood and beware: Mess with her children, and you answer to mama.
Hero/Info/Zeratul=The enigmatic dark templar Zeratul serves the xel'naga. While he expertly wields the power of the Void, it is his wisdom that earns him the respect of the Koprulu sector's leaders - despite his penchant for dramatic entrances.

LoadingScreen/Help00=As a battle begins, type "GL, HF"  to communicate "Good Luck, Have Fun!" to your allies.
LoadingScreen/Help01=You can report inappropriate behavior at the end of a match by right-clicking on a player on the Score Screen.
LoadingScreen/Help02=Teams that support one another are more effective. Play nice and win more games.
LoadingScreen/Help03=Support your team, even if you don't agree on strategy. Working together is better than going it alone.
LoadingScreen/Help04=Have a great match? Start a party by inviting teammates on the Score Screen after the game!
LoadingScreen/Help05=Your level is shared across your entire team. If one teammate gains experience, so does everyone else.
LoadingScreen/Help06=You don't need to deliver the killing blow to gain experience for killing a Minion, Fort, or enemy Hero.
LoadingScreen/Help07=A gold "XP" symbol appears near dying targets if you are close enough to gain experience from them.
LoadingScreen/Help08=Try to have at least one Hero near every battle to maximize your team's experience gain.
LoadingScreen/Help09=Death timers increase as the match progresses.  Be careful, dying in the late-game can have a heavy cost.
LoadingScreen/Help10=Destroying enemy Forts, killing Minions and Heroes, and capturing Mercenaries will earn experience for your whole team.
LoadingScreen/Help11=Destroying the Fort and Keep in a lane will add Catapults to that lane's wave of Minions.
LoadingScreen/Help12=Attacks from Forts and Keeps slow both your Movement and Attack Speed.
LoadingScreen/Help13=A blue "Eye" appears over your Hero when you are hidden from enemy sight. A red "Eye" means you have been revealed.
LoadingScreen/Help14=Defensive Structures can run out of ammo.  Ammo slowly replenishes over time.
LoadingScreen/Help15=Many abilities can Slow or Root your Hero, making it difficult or impossible to move.
LoadingScreen/Help16=Some Abilities can Stun or Silence your Hero, preventing you from using your Abilities.
LoadingScreen/Help17=Abilities that make a Hero "Unstoppable" remove or prevent most negative effects like Roots, Slows and Stuns.
LoadingScreen/Help18=Some Talent combinations are more effective on different Battlegrounds.
LoadingScreen/Help19=Choose Talents that offset your team's weaknesses or counteract the enemy's strengths.
LoadingScreen/Help20=If the enemy team hits level 10 before you, be careful! They have their Heroic abilities and can more easily win fights.
LoadingScreen/Help21=If the enemy hits level 20 before you, be careful! Level 20 Talents are very powerful.
LoadingScreen/Help22=Playing with friends grants you a 50% bonus to experience granted after playing a match.
LoadingScreen/Help23=Gold rewards are granted as your Heroes level up. Explore different Heroes to acquire more gold.
LoadingScreen/Help24=Enable "Right-Click through Minimap" in the Gameplay Options menu to prevent accidental clicks on the Minimap.
LoadingScreen/Help25=The "Quick Cast" option in the Hotkeys Option menu allows your Abilities to be cast more quickly.
LoadingScreen/Help26=Never surrender! Even if your team is behind you can win a big fight and start a comeback.
LoadingScreen/Help27=The enemy team gains experience each time your Hero dies. Retreat when you're low on health and heal up before fighting again.
LoadingScreen/Help28=Support Heroes are great at helping your team stay alive. Pair up with another Hero and together you can defeat the enemy.
LoadingScreen/Help29=Standing in shrubs or smoke can hide your Hero from the enemy's sight. Use shrubs to ambush enemies or to escape pursuit.
LoadingScreen/Help30=Press the <k val="MinimapPing"/> key and left-click to ping a location, objective, or Hero.
LoadingScreen/Help31=Hold the <k val="MinimapPing"/> key and the left mouse button to bring up a menu with several types of pings.
LoadingScreen/Help32=Press the <k val="ChatDefault"/> key to chat with your allies.
LoadingScreen/Help33=Press the <k val="PingSelection5"/> key to tell your allies to retreat.
LoadingScreen/Help34=Press the <k val="HeroLeaderPanel"/> key to see the Scorescreen in the game. Once there, click the "Talent" button to see how other players have specialized their Hero.
LoadingScreen/Help36="Quick Cast" in the Hotkeys Option menu allows your abilities to be customized per Hero, per Ability.
LoadingScreen/Help37=The Armor stat reduces the amount of damage a Hero takes from Basic Attacks and Abilities.
LoadingScreen/Help38=Each point of Armor reduces the damage a Hero takes by 1%. For example: 10 Armor reduces damage by 10%.
LoadingScreen/Help39=Physical Armor reduces the damage of Basic Attacks; Spell Armor reduces the damage of Abilities.
LoadingScreen/Help40=A Hero's Armor can be reduced below 0, causing attacks to deal more damage than usual.
LoadingScreen/Help41=The maximum armor a hero can have is +75 and the minimum is -25. Certain Hero talents can alter these limits.
LoadingScreen/Help42=The Target Info Panel can be dragged to a custom location. Double-clicking the panel will reset it to the default location.
LookAtType/RobotArmsOnly=Robot Arms Only

LootChest/Description/WelcomeChest=An exclusive Loot Chest that guarantees at least one random Hero.

Video/Tutorial_Veteran/Line00001=A Veteran, you say? I'll keep it short then.
Video/Tutorial_Veteran/Line00002=You might think the Nexus is familiar, but each battleground here is unique.
Video/Tutorial_Veteran/Line00003=And you'll need to handle new situations as they arise.
Video/Tutorial_Veteran/Line00004=That means taking control of deadly monsters.
Video/Tutorial_Veteran/Line00005=Defeating powerful bosses.
Video/Tutorial_Veteran/Line00006=And controlling devastating weapons.
Video/Tutorial_Veteran/Line00007=Each battleground has mercenaries. Capture them to push forward a lane of battle or to split your enemy's attention.
Video/Tutorial_Veteran/Line00008=This is a fort. It's your enemy's first line of defense. 
Video/Tutorial_Veteran/Line00009=To take one down, first you need to destroy the gate. Then you can demolish the fort from the inside.
Video/Tutorial_Veteran/Line00010=Most forts also have a healing fountain which can restore your health every so often.
Video/Tutorial_Veteran/Line00011=Destroying it means your enemy has to move further back to heal.
Video/Tutorial_Veteran/Line00012=Remember that last bit, in the Nexus momentum is everything.
Video/Tutorial_Veteran/Line00013=As we fight, our whole team gains experience. No one has to apologize for taking down an enemy or healing an ally, so they can rush back into combat.
Video/Tutorial_Veteran/Line00014=Every few team levels you can pick a talent to customize your hero's abilities, and you can do it on the fly in the middle of the battlefield. Everything you do contributes to making the team stronger. We fight together, and we win together.
Video/Tutorial_Veteran/Line00015=Well that about covers everything, but before you go...
Video/Tutorial_Veteran/Line00016=There are always new things to see in the Nexus. As you fight, you'll unlock tons of new stuff.
Video/Tutorial_Veteran/Line00017=I'll see you on the battlefield.
VisionBeacon=VisionBeacon
